turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: This isn't a feud, this is war. They've got more men than we do. We kill detectives, they can replace 'em in a day.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: So what do we do, General Lee?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Just like in the war. Harass their supply lines. We kill the railroad's men, they won't care.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'll pick the first job! I mean... I know a girl down at the bank. See if she can't get a list of towns where the railroad keeps its money.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Perfect, Cole.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Let's ride.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The James-Younger Gang.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Don't let it happen again.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I got seven thousand.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I got three.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: See, Frank's being smart about this.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Just because he reads all those books and knows all those big words doesn't make him smart.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It's not a bank.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: It's better. It's a construction depot. They'll have the strongbox and some ammo and explosives for us to take. That way we can take on a bigger job.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: "The Fidelity Bank and Trust was robbed on Tuesday by a gang of twenty heavily armed men."

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Twenty?!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Jesse, we got to have a word.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Sure, cousin.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: All the posters and newspapers are calling this bunch the "James-Younger Gang."

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Why aren't we the "Younger-James Gang"? I mean, there's three Younger brothers and only two James brothers here.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: This is your fault for hogging all the publicity.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Hold on, hold on, we all know Bob is an important part of the gang.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It'll be the biggest score yet.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What will be?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Smells funny, it being mentioned in the paper.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: If you'd read about it first, you'd have no problems.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I've robbed just as many banks as you have! I know this town, and I know this bank, and I say it's an easy job.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You're forgetting who's in charge --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Beautiful.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Now the one time one of us comes up with an idea --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: A bad idea.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I got us through the War all right.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And almost got hanged in peacetime.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'm the better soldier, Jesse.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And I'm the better outlaw.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Still smells fishy.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Then let me run the show, General Lee.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Fine. We hit this bank.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You'll be smiling once you've got all that money to spend, cousin.  Cole Younger's going to make everybody rich!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Dammit!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: A trap.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Okay, you're gonna rest here.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Clell, Tom, go get Doc Mimms in Liberty!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Bob, rip up some bandages.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Pass me some whisky.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: We'll make them pay for this.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm out.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: WHAT?! We follow you for a year, and now that our blood's been spilled, you're gonna quit?!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Who's next? You? Me? Bob?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Missed you, cousin.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Missed you too, cousin.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You know, you gettin' caught, right after leaving us, some people thought --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Pff. All we been through, the thought never crossed my mind.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Where'd you get all these riders?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: We didn't. Zerelda did. Turns out your wife makes a hell of an outlaw.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Some Indian tracker you turned out to be, Tom.

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: You pay me to find you Bluecoats. There they are.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Wait'll we get back to Missouri, start telling those gals about how little Jesse James charged the whole Union Army by himself!

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: You ride like a Comanche.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Tom, why don't you stop at our spread before you head on out to the reservation? Figure we might have some work for you, if you want.

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: Hmm. Go back to the reservation and get drunk in a dirt shack, or work for you...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: I'm thinking...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Cannon or Gatling?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Both would be nice.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Soon as I hit one, the other'll know and beat us up.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What the --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Must be a garrison in town. We're in occupied territory, boys.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I think one of 'em's glass.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Which one, right or left?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The brown one.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, Lord, the dance hall girl at Bunty's...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Sadie was not a man!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I have no idea what you just said, but it sounded real nice.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shakespeare.  He's European.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: BASTARDS! Come back here and face me!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Get buckets!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Hey! We decide something, that's it! We're in this for the long haul, and this idea of me and Jesse's will help give us more places to hide out without worrying about some farmer with a shotgun sneakin' up on us in our sleep. We've got to think --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Strategically.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: -- Exactly. Because this is a war.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jesse.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Oh, you're in charge? We ain't partners any more, Jesse? You tell Cole Younger where and when to ride?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Cole, he didn't mean that.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Another dozen out back.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They gonna rush us?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: They're just insurance in case we run.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The safe. Now.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Of course!  Uh, sir?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Where is Jesse James?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: This here is the Younger Gang!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: OPEN THE DAMN SAFE!

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: All right, all right.  Jesse James never yelled at folk...

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: You 'um big lawman?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Yeah, Injun. What do you want?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: Great Chief of St. Louis send me.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: The District Marshall

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Of St. Louis?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: Ho-yah. Him say tell Big Lawman in Carville that badman Jesse James riding toward Rising Sun, above Great River, near Eagle Rock.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: East? East above the river heading for the Eagle Pass?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: Ho-yah!

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Go ahead to the saloon. But don't get too drunk!

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: Me get heap firewater --

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: I know it ain't no durned bank holiday!

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: You're right, sir.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Then why can't I go in there?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: On account of we're robbing it.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Oh. Why didn't you just say so?

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: It's a secret.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Fine. I'll just wait here.

turns.speaker: COMANCHE TOM
turns.text: I'd appreciate that.

turns.speaker: SHERRIFF
turns.text: What the --

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SHERRIFF
turns.text: Old Man Tucker is just standing quiet outside the bank.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: SHERRIFF
turns.text: When have you ever known Old Man Tucker not to be yelling at everybody?

turns.speaker: SHERRIFF
turns.text: Where the hell were you?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: I had you covered.  From back there.

turns.speaker: SHERRIFF
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: -- rode right into them, screaming like a banshee.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: My little Web did that?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Pff. He jumped his horse clear over our heads, killed a dozen Union soldiers before they knew what hit them.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: Web died fighting?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Died a hero.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: Boys...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Go home, Doc.  They ain't gonna hang no more Liberty boys.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What do you say, sir?

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: Go on. You're pretty much all healed up.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: You know you're welcome any time!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yesss, but I was thinking, I could come by, and then take Zee out. Some place near. With other folk. Near. Here.  But out.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: It's fine by me, Jesse.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Daddy, don't start with this again.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: Zerelda, it's no coincidence. The railroad men come through, offering to buy up land. Nobody sells. Then they start hanging men who own farms for treason?

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: He's going to be fine, right Daddy?

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: The bullet came out clean, but he lost a whole lot of blood. Praying wouldn't hurt.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: They're gone. What are you --

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: I fooled them into thinking I was alone.

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: Well, I hope the boy pulls through. We should know in the morning.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: I think he's already feeling better.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: He thinks this is some kind of game!

turns.speaker: DOC MIMMS
turns.text: I'm upset too, Zee, but Jesse and Cole know what they're doing. I'm sure they won't press their luck.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Every time I put my head up to hit that Gatling, they try to shoot it off.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: So we got a plan?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Distracting enough for you?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Pff. They hardly even noticed you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: So you're saying I could have done more to attract their attention.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You could have worn one of those big, floppy woman's Easter Sunday hats.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That would have made an impression.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I figure.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: See, that's your problem, Frank. By the time you finish figuring out stuff, I'm already finished doing it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, Jesse, your problem is you're always doing stuff before I'm finished figuring it out.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Web's dead.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I reckoned.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Hell of a war.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm sure it seemed like a good idea at the time.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hello, Liberty Missoura!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: All this time in the saddle... We get to the farm, I'm going to shoot this damn horse just on principle.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Looks like Web Mimms wasn't the only casualty this town's got.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We better go to Doc's, see what's going on here.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Frank, don't you have something to say?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're doing just fine.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Zee, we got to talk to you and your father.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Whyyyy... he took down the Gatling gun and the cannon all by himself.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Saved all our lives, Doc. None of the Liberty boys would have come home if not for Web Mimms, Doc. God's honest truth.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: All we thought about was coming home. I swore I'd kill anybody who tried to get me off my farm again. If I have to go to war with the railroad to stay, fine by me.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Think about this. If we just come up with a story and stick to it, we should be all right.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What kind of story are they going to believe?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That just might work.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maybe, maybe...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: "Big and older"?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You can shut up now.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You are a charmer.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I swear I'll shoot you in your sleep.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Next time try "fat and haggard."

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: She's still talking to Jesus.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What worries me is that Jesus is talking back.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: -- if you stop saying things about my Zee.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Your Zee? Hmm.  "From women's eyes this doctrine I derive: they sparkle still the right Promethean fire; They are the books, the arts, the academes, that show, contain, and nourish all the world."

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You know him?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Heard of him.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I went up to the courthouse and looked at the right of way documents for the rail bed. The railroad doesn't even need our land, they're just taking the land on both sides for as far as they can.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Damn. All that reading paid off.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You ready to stop loafing around with this young lady and get back to farming?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Would you get in the carriage? Until Ma has you home so she can fuss over you herself, she's gonna make me miserable.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're looking a bit more spry now that somebody --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Shut up.  Uh, Doc, I was wondering if, uh, this evening, I could come by?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Pinkertons. It's the railroad.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ma.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: ... We could move on. Rebuild. Make a decent life someplace else.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Don't care.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Didn't think you would.  I'm going to go make the coffin.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Make a thousand of 'em. Still won't be enough by the time I'm through.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How'd it go in there?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Fine. How'd it go out here?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We're gonna have to talk...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And I planned getting you off the hangman's deck --

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: And that's why you both lead the gang. Two of you went into that bank together, right?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: And it's guarded by Pinkerton detectives.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And I do so want to shoot some Pinkerton detectives.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I don't think it's counterfeit. Do you mind if I take a look at all your real bills to compare?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's the scientific method. It's all the rage.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Gents, we are in the middle of something here.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Bob's upset.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The posters?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Pardon the delay, folks, but we had to get Mad Bob Younger under control!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Bob here'll kill a man for sneezing, and he's the best shot in the gang.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: This has been a good year.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jesse, we're outlaws.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: And we're good at it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It got to you, didn't it. All the killing in the war. You need it now.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You've killed your fair share of men.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: If I could go back to farming --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: That's a lie. You could've bought a dozen farms with the money we've stolen.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I can't quit and leave you alone. I can't quit until you quit. Ma would've wanted it that way.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: We're doing this for Ma.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Maybe it started out that way. But now...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What do you want me to say, Frank? I was killing men when I was fifteen. I like getting shot at. I like riding out of town with a posse at my back. This is a helluva better life than farming.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: A better life than the one you could have had with Zee?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We're drunk.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Just do me a favor. Think about what this is costing everybody. Not just the railroad.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You taking sides against me, now, Frank?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, I --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: They're all pinned down. Can't even get to the door.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Got any ideas, little brother?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Shoulda learned with Web. Made it look fun, made it look like an adventure. Got Web killed. Now Jim.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jim was old enough...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: He was a boy riding with the most famous outlaws in the West. How was he supposed to say no to that?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Railroad burned him out too. You couldn't have stopped him.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You're a piss-poor liar for the smartest man I know.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: A war against the railroad. What the hell were we thinking?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm sure it seemed like a good idea at the time.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'll meet you down there in a few weeks.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: See you soon. Oh, and I appreciate the distraction back there.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hell, they hardly even noticed us.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Y'know, Uncle Frank...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: ...every time you tell that story, you stop there. That's not how it ended. I was five when my dad got shot.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I know. But that's how it should have ended. Your Dad and Mom, riding off into a new life, growing old together, happy.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Allow a man his version of the past. When you get to be my age, you've got enough painful memories, you're allowed to soften a few of the edges up.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Sounds like he was a hell of a man.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: That he was.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: They're making him a hero now.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Saved a lot of folk from the railroad.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But he killed a lot of men, too.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Can't argue that.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: So what was he?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I think... he was just a real interestin' fella to have around.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Uncle Frank?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: How much of that story is true?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Everything but the boring parts.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Did you kill Yankees?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: A fair number, Ma.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Say your prayers?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ma, I'm glad to see you being nice to our Injun friend.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: He's a good Christian and he killed Yankees. Jesus told me that made him an all right boy.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Easterners.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: We're just fine, thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: The Lord says we can bury 'em out back in the orchard, nobody'll ever find them.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Somebody's in a vengeful smiting mood today.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ma! Please!

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Boys?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Riders --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: We know, Ma. Now we got to get you to Doc Mimms.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Take care of each other, boys. You say your prayers.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Doc Mimms will --

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Shush.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Zerelda? Little Zee Mimms?

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You were little Jesse James when you left.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: But you got big!

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: But still died.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: If there's anything we can do for you, Dr. Mimms. We want to help.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Jesse, are you awake?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Mmmm.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Jesse, is that your hand?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Nuh-huh ...

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You shouldn't be up.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I've been on my back two weeks. I'm sick of it.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You're sick of my company?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No! I mean, of course not. No.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Teasing you is completely unfair.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What you do to me is unfair. The teasing, I mean.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: I shouldn't tease a hero.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Everybody in the county knows it was you who rescued Cole. We're all so proud of you, Jesse. And not a single farm's been sold to the railroad since. You're everybody's hero.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I wasn't the only one risking my neck that day.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: So you're saying I should leave you alone and go spend time with Jimmy Younger?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Unfair. You are completely unfair.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I used to come to this tree when I was a kid and imagine what my life would be like when I got older.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You didn't want to farm?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I was thinking more along the lines of being a river pirate.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: A river pirate.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Arr. Hand over your jewels, Missy.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Thank God you grew out of that.  You did grow out of that, didn't you?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Mostly. It would be an all right life, for a bachelor.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You planning on being a bachelor your whole life, Jesse James?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Not if I find the right girl.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: And what's this right girl like?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Smart. Funny. Bossy. Always makes me think she's two steps ahead of me. And big buck teeth.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Where will you find such a girl?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Honestly, you'd do if only you had the buck teeth.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ahem. "From this doctrine..." No, ah... "From women's eyes this doctrine I derive, they sparkle still like ... shiny... sparkling rocks..."

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Sparkling rocks?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Little ones.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Is this one of Frank's Shakespeare poems you're trying to quote?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Were you planning on kissing me when you finished quoting?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I've been planning on kissin' you for a very long time.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: I am so sorry, Jesse.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Frank and me have to go away for a while.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: You and I, we've started... something, you know?  I don't know what'll happen if you do this.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Me neither.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Let the law --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Laws don't touch men like Thaddeus Rains. Only justice does.

turns.speaker: ZEE
turns.text: Whose justice? Yours or God's?  When will you stop?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: When my name makes them cry in their sleep. When I've brought them to ashes.
